w:r.w:t: This lesson will talk about the primary colors
and basic understanding of conversations. Ideally, these words will help your student practice their descriptions of different objects of varying color.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the color words BLUE, RED, and YELLOW
Spell and pronounce words that are commonly associated with those colors
and associated words in complete sentences
Whale, Leaf, Truck, Fish, Shoe, Bird, Bus, Hair, House, Apple, Shirt
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning
Use TPR and repetition to teach the correct answer of the color in the pictures.
Introduce the color word “blue” by saying the word, spelling the word, sounding it phonetically, and pronouncing it again. Then, ask students to complete the same process.
, begin spelling out the word as well.
Use TPR and props to help teach the word “bird”
Work through the answer to this sentence with the student.
Use TPR to demonstrate “yes” and “no” responses
Circle the object that is blue
Use TPR to demonstrate “yes” or “no” responses until you arrive to the correct response (bird).
Circle the words that sound like: BL
Back, blink, bring, block, blank, by, bite, black, bark, bored
Find the words that make the sound “BL”
Introduce the color word “red” by saying the word, spelling the word, sounding it phonetically, and pronouncing it again. Then, ask students to complete the same process.
If possible, begin spelling out the word as well.
Teach the word “shoe”. Use TPR and bring a prop as well to help demonstrate the meaning of the word.
Find the correct answer. Use TPR to demonstrate “Yes” and “no” response to the varyin
Circle the object that is red
Use TPR to demonstrate “yes” and “no” responses to the other pictures.
Teach the word Yellow! If time allows, spell it out with your student.
Bring props of other things that might be yellow.
Teach the word fish. Use TPR and other visual illustrations to teach demonstrate “fish”
Use TPR to demonstrate “yes” and “no” responses to finish the answer (yellow).
Instruct your student to draw a line from the word to its object.
Show them how to do it and have they repeat your steps if they do not understand.
Have your student repeat after you in saying each of these sentences.
Have them say the correct color of their respective objects in the picture.
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Use TPR to ask your student if they have things that are blue, red, or yellow.
You can also bring some things of your own to further discuss these colors.
Whale, leaf, truck, fish, shoe, bird, bus, hair, house, apple, shirt
Have the student repeat each of these words back to you.
If time allows, you can ask them “what is
______?” and then have them circle the picture that represent your object.
